movies.title: F.P.1 Doesn't Answer
movies.plot: Urged by famous airman Ellissen the Lennartz Company puts into reality the project proposed by his friend Droste: F.P.1, a huge floating platform in the Atlantic that makes long-distance flights viable. Ellissen is in love with company heiress Claire, but when he returns from his adventures to save the endangered F.P.1 he finds out that he has lost her to Droste.
movies.simplePlot: Urged by famous airman Ellissen the Lennartz Company puts into reality the project proposed by his friend Droste: F.P.1, a huge floating platform in the Atlantic that makes long-distance ...

biography.bio: Life companion was the actress Hansi Burg. Their relationship started in 1925. They separated in 1935 due to the pressure of the German Nazi government. In 1938 she went into exile in Switzerland (later London). Shortly after this she married the Norwegian Erich Blydt. Burg returned to Germany and Albers in 1946. They lived together until his death 1960. She died 15 years later.
biography.name: Hans Albers

biography.bio: The enigmatic actress remains one of the most interesting figures in German film. Although she achieved stardom early in her career, the tragic Sybille Schmitz could never fit in with her surroundings. Too "alien looking" for Hollywood, Schmitz never migrated to America like her more glamorous peers and began losing roles in her native Germany as well due to her vaguely Semitic appearance and ties to the Jewish community. After the war, like many former UFA stars, Sybille was seen as a painful reminder of the Third Reich and she was once more displaced by the optimistic "new look" actresses. With acting being her sole reason to thrive, Sybille Schmitz began to drink heavily and rely on drugs as her career sank lower and lower. She finally committed suicide under mysterious circumstances on April 13, 1955, while being "cared for" by a corrupt lesbian doctor she was living with at the time of her death.
biography.name: Sybille Schmitz

biography.bio: Paul Hartmann was born on January 8, 1889 in Fürth, Bavaria, Germany as Paul Wilhelm Constantin Hartmann. He was an actor, known for The Longest Day (1962), Pour le Mérite (1938) and I accuse (1941). He was married to Elfriede Lieberum. He died on June 30, 1977 in Munich, Bavaria, West Germany.
biography.name: Paul Hartmann

biography.bio: As a youth Peter Lorre ran away from home, worked as a bank clerk and, after stage training in Vienna, made his acting debut in Zurich. He remained unknown, traveling for several years and acting in Germany, Austria and Switzerland, until Fritz Lang cast him as the psychopathic child killer in M (1931). After several more films in Germany, Lorre left as the Nazis came to power, going to Paris, London and, in 1935, Hollywood. He played Raskolnikov in Crime and Punishment (1935) and a series of Mr. Moto movies during the late 1930s. He began his pairing with Sydney Greenstreet as Joel Cairo in The Maltese Falcon (1941), continued in Casablanca (1942) and seven other films during the early 1940s. In Germany he wrote, directed and starred in L'homme perdu (1951). After that, somewhat heavier, he played in a string of not-so-stellar efforts, one exception being his role as a clown in The Big Circus (1959). He died the year he made his last movie, playing a stooge in Jerry Lewis' The Patsy (1964).
biography.name: Peter Lorre
nicknames: Europe's One Man Chamber of Horrors

biography.bio: Hermann Speelmans was born on August 14, 1906 in Uerdingen, Krefeld, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany as Hermann Maria Louise Speelmans. He was an actor, known for The Adventures of Baron Munchausen (1943), Sherlock Holmes: The Grey Lady (1937) and Die letzten Vier von Santa Cruz (1936). He died on February 9, 1960 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Hermann Speelmans

biography.bio: Paul Westermeier was born on July 9, 1892 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for The Devil's General (1955), II-A in Berlin (1956) and Im Tingeltangel tut sich was (1964). He died on October 17, 1972 in Berlin.
biography.name: Paul Westermeier

biography.bio: Friedrich Gnaß was born on November 13, 1892 in Langendreer, Bochum, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. He was an actor, known for M (1931), Das Stacheltier - Letztes Fach unten rechts (1955) and Katzgraben (1957). He died on May 8, 1958 in East Berlin, East Germany.
biography.name: Friedrich Gnaß

biography.bio: Georg John was born on July 23, 1879 in Schmiegel, Poland as Georg Jacobsohn. He was an actor, known for M (1931), The Last Laugh (1924) and Dr. Mabuse: The Gambler (1922). He died on November 18, 1941 in Lódz, Lódzkie, Poland.
biography.name: Georg John

biography.bio: Georg August Koch was born on January 15, 1883 in Kassel, Germany. He was an actor, known for Les nibelungen, la vengeance de Kriemhild (1924), Finances of the Grand Duke (1924) and Pauken und Trompeten (1955). He died on December 25, 1963 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Georg August Koch

biography.bio: Philipp Manning was born on November 23, 1869 in Lewisham, England as Phillip Gustav Valère Manning. He is known for his work on K 1 greift ein (1933), Hast Du geliebt am schönen Rhein? (1927) and Dupont et cie (1931). He died on April 10, 1951 in Baden, West Germany.
biography.name: Philipp Manning

biography.bio: Erik Ode was born on November 6, 1910 in Berlin, Germany as Fritz Erik Signy Odemar. He was an actor and director, known for Der Kommissar (1969), Sonne, Wein und harte Nüsse (1977) and Liebe, Jazz und Übermut (1957). He was married to Hilde Volk. He died on July 19, 1983 in Weißach, Kreuth, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Erik Ode

biography.bio: Arthur Peiser is an actor, known for F.P.1 Doesn't Answer (1932), Liebe ist Liebe (1932) and A Woman Like You (1933).
biography.name: Arthur Peiser

biography.bio: Rudolf Platte was born on February 12, 1904 in Hörde [now Dortmund], Germany as Rudolf Antonius Heinrich Platte. He was an actor, known for Veronika Voss (1982), Destination Death (1964) and The Buddenbrooks (1959). He was married to Marina Ried, Georgia Lind and Vally Hager. He died on December 18, 1984 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Rudolf Platte

biography.bio: Gustav Püttjer was born on May 15, 1886 in Hamburg, Germany. He was an actor and production manager, known for The White Dove (1960), La tragédie de la mine (1931) and The 3 Penny Opera (1931). He died on August 11, 1959 in East Berlin, East Germany.
biography.name: Gustav Püttjer

biography.bio: Hans Schneider is an actor, known for Anekdoten um den alten Fritz (1935), F.P.1 Doesn't Answer (1932) and Die lange Grete (1936).
biography.name: Hans Schneider
